intro: Aucuba luteocarpa, commonly known as the yellow-fruited aucuba, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Cornaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by orange to yellow berries. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit. Aucuba luteocarpa is relatively hardy and can thrive in a variety of soil types and light conditions.
